meanings.definition: The quality or state of being impractical.
meanings.sent1: The teacher discussed the impracticalities of building a spaceship in our backyard.
meanings.sent2: She realized the impracticalities of carrying all her books in one small bag.
meanings.sent3: Trying to fit a giraffe in a tiny car would highlight the impracticalities of the situation.
meanings.sent4: His dream of flying without wings showcased the impracticalities of his imagination.
meanings.sent5: The clown's attempt to juggle elephants illustrated the impracticalities of his circus act.

meanings.definition: Something that is impractical or not feasible.
meanings.sent1: The team brainstormed solutions to overcome the impracticalities of their plan.
meanings.sent2: Carrying a whale in a backpack is a perfect example of impracticalities.
meanings.sent3: The idea of using a spoon to dig a swimming pool emphasized the impracticalities of the task.
meanings.sent4: Her plan to travel to Mars on a paper airplane highlighted the impracticalities of her goal.
meanings.sent5: The proposal to build a house of cards on a windy day demonstrated the impracticalities of the project.
